place.name: COEDANA
place.gazetteerText: COEDANA, a parochial chapelry in the district and county of Anglesey; 2 miles SE of Llanerchymedd r. station, and 13 WNW of Beaumaris. Post town, Llanerchymedd, under Bangor. Acres, 1, 627. Real property, £1, 476. Pop., 275. Houses, 65. The property is divided among a few. The living is a p. curacy, annexed to the rectory of Llaneilian, in the diocese of Bangor. The church is ancient. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
